ovdesc.p: Matching criteria, allow amount splitting, record retention and DELIVERY data interfaces.

desc.p: Defines the name of the main record on the file.
The single record on this file must always be named 'SYSTEM'.
Can only be 'SYSTEM'. (Mandatory Input)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field will contain the field name by which the user wishes to match items. The user may select one or more fields per Trans.Type as required.
20 character sub-valued alphanumeric field
This field contains the type of record that will be generated for the Globus.Location file. This may be either DIVERT or MESSAGE
7 character alphanumeric field Acceptable Input - DIVERT and MESSAGE
Contains details of any overrides applicable to this item.
Conditions where overrides will be required include the following:
Item split created
Excess cents transferred to excess cents bucket
Matching fields do not match (eg. Value dates different, Transaction types different etc)
No Input allowed (Populated by the system when overrides occur)
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This field determines how long (in days) matched items remain on the live items file before being transferred to the history file.
3 character numeric field Indicates number of days
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

This field contains transaction type identification code by which items will be matched in the automatic matching process. This allows the user to determine how certain transactions should be matched (eg. for items on a S.W.I.F.T. statement, the user may wish to match miscellaneous [NMSC] transactions by Value.Date and Amount but match cheques [NCHK] by Amount only). If this field is not required, it should be left blank.
For entries related to payment and transfer instructions, including related charges messages, not sent through S.W.I.F.T. or where an alpha description is preferred.
Format: Naaa
The last three characters must be one of the following codes, indicating the reason for the entry:

BOE Bill of Exchange BRF Brokerage Fee CHG Charges and Other Expenses CHK Cheques CLR Cash Letter/Cheques Remittance COL Collections (used when entering a principal amount) COM Commission DCR Documentary Credit (used when entering a principal amount) DIV Dividends Warrants EQA Equivalent Amount ECK Eurocheques FEX Foreign Exchange INT Interest LBX Lock Box1. LDP Loan Deposit MSC Miscellaneous RTI Returned Item SEC Securities (used when entering a principal amount) STO Standing Order TCK Travellers Cheques TRF Transfer VDA Value Date Adjustment
For entries being first advised by the statement (items originated by the Account Servicing Institution):
Format: Faaa
The last three characters must be an appropriate code indicating the reason for the entry (i.e. the codes listed above).
4 character multi-valued alphanumeric field
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field allows the user to determine whether item 'splits' are allowed in the manual matching process. Item splits are never allowed in the automatching process.
Allowed input 'Y' or blank
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field contains the name of the record into which outgoing statements will be diverted. If the Globus.Type field is set to MESSAGE, this field should be left blank.
20 character alphanumeric field
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in the Item file up to 999 Local Elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These Local Elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.

The name(s) of the new element(s), as well as the Format and
Validation Rules:, must be defined in the LOCAL.TABLE, prior to the creation of any Item records.

Up to 35 characters as defined in the Local Table definition for this Local Reference field. Multivalue field. (Optional or Mandatory Input according to definition in LOCAL.TABLE for this Local Reference element)
As defined by the User within the LOCAL.TABLE and LOCAL.REF.TABLE.
Reserved for future use
No Input allowed
This field contains the location (ie. file name) that incoming statements will be routed to when generated.
20 character alphanumeric field name
This field contains the name of the record into which incoming statements will be diverted. If the External.Type field is set to MESSAGE, this field should be left blank.
20 character alphanumeric field
This field contains the type of record that will be generated for the External.Location file. This may be either DIVERT or MESSAGE
7 character alphanumeric field Acceptable Input - DIVERT and MESSAGE
This field contains the location (ie. file name) that outgoing statements will be routed to when generated.
20 character alphanumeric field name
